text: Honey is the only food that never spoils — 3,000-year-old honey from Egyptian tombs was still edible.
Peanuts aren't nuts — they're legumes that grow underground.
Vanilla is the world's second most expensive spice after saffron.
The world's most expensive coffee, Kopi Luwak, is made from beans eaten and excreted by civets.
Capsaicin in chili peppers triggers pain receptors, not taste buds — spicy isn't actually a flavor.
Nutmeg is hallucinogenic in large doses and was once used as an abortifacient.
Carrots were originally purple until Dutch growers bred orange ones in the 17th century.
Chocolate was consumed as a bitter drink for most of its history — milk chocolate was invented in 1875.
Corn, potatoes, and tomatoes were unknown in Europe before Columbus.
Almonds are seeds, not nuts — they're related to peaches and plums.
Apples float because they're 25% air.
McDonald's sells 75 hamburgers every second worldwide.
Ketchup was sold as medicine in the 1830s to treat diarrhea.
Lobsters were considered poverty food and fed to prisoners until the mid-1800s.
Twinkies have a shelf life of 45 days, not the mythical 'forever.'
Worcestershire sauce is made from fermented anchovies.
Ranch dressing was invented by a plumber on a dude ranch in California in 1954.
Grapes explode when microwaved because the electromagnetic waves superheat the water inside.
Ripe cranberries bounce like rubber balls — it's actually used as a quality test.
Fresh figs contain wasp bodies — wasps crawl inside to pollinate and are digested by enzymes.
Lemons float while limes sink because lemons have lower density.
Arachibutyrophobia is the fear of peanut butter sticking to the roof of your mouth.
The stickers on fruit are edible and FDA-approved.
Potatoes have more potassium than bananas.
The fear of cooking is called mageirocophobia.
White chocolate isn't technically chocolate because it contains no cocoa solids.
Astronauts can't eat bread in space because crumbs float and could damage equipment.
German chocolate cake was named after Sam German, not Germany.
Wasabi is so expensive that most 'wasabi' is actually dyed horseradish.
Cotton candy was co-invented by a dentist in 1897.
Cucumbers are 96% water — more than watermelons.
Mountain Dew was originally created as a whiskey chaser.
Cheese is the most stolen food in the world.
Chewing gum while cutting onions can prevent tears by encouraging mouth breathing.
Jell-O is made from collagen extracted from animal bones and hides.
Strawberries aren't berries, but bananas are — botanically speaking.
The Maillard reaction, which browns food when cooked, produces over 1,000 different flavor compounds.
Oysters are still alive when you eat them raw.
One in four hazelnuts ends up in Nutella.
Pound cake got its name because the original recipe called for a pound each of butter, sugar, eggs, and flour.
Spam (the food) is short for 'spiced ham' — probably.
Honey is the only food that includes all the substances necessary to sustain life.
The sandwich was named after the Earl of Sandwich, who wanted to eat without leaving the gambling table.
Popsicles were invented by an 11-year-old who accidentally left soda outside overnight in winter.
Tea bags were invented by accident when a tea merchant sent samples in silk bags.
Microwave popcorn bags are lined with chemicals that break down into carcinogens when heated.
The holes in Swiss cheese are caused by bacteria releasing CO2 bubbles during fermentation.
Cashews are actually seeds that grow attached to cashew apples.
The red juice from steak isn't blood — it's myoglobin, a protein that stores oxygen in muscle.
Blue foods are rare in nature because the pigment is difficult to produce biologically.
